alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Coal; Garvin; Hughes; Johnston; Marshall; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 3:44PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Johnston, northeastern Garvin, Coal, southern Seminole, Pontotoc, northeastern Marshall, western Atoka, eastern Murray, south central Pottawatomie, southwestern Hughes and southeastern McClain Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 343 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Stratford to 6 miles west of Pontotoc to near Nida. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ada, Sulphur, Atoka, Tishomingo, Coalgate, Wynnewood, Stratford, Konawa, Byng, Allen, Roff, Ravia, Stonewall, Wapanucka, Stringtown, Bowlegs, Lehigh, Tupelo, Mill Creek and Milburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Atoka; Coal; Garvin; Hughes; Johnston; Marshall; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
